title: 'Bachelor in Paradise' preview: Tayshia regrets dumping John Paul Jones
text:
Tayshia Adams and John Paul Jones were one of the most unexpected couples to form during "Bachelor in Paradise," but their split still made fans sad.

However, maybe their romance isn't dead?

In a preview for Tuesday's finale episode, Adams tells host Chris Harrison that she decided to fly to Maryland to ask Jones for a second chance after filming ending.

"I talked to my mom about it and I decided I wanted to go after him," she explained. "I'm a bold girl."

Viewers will find out the fate of Adam and Jones' relationship, as well as what happens with the others left on on the show when the episode airs at 8 p.m ET/PT on ABC.

Going into the last episode, four couples remain: Nicole Lopez-Alvar and Clay Harbor; Hannah Godwin and Dylan Barbour; Chris Bukowksi and Katie Morton; and Demi Burnett and Kristian Haggerty.
